snippet: In his purge of Egypt’s top generals, President Mohamed Morsi leaned on the support of a junior officer corps that blamed the old guard for a litany of problems within the military.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi, in his purge of Egypt's top generals, leans on the support of a junior officer corps that blamed the old guard for a litany of problems within the military; the changing of the guard leaves an uncertain landscape.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller contributed reporting from Fort Campbell, Ky.

lead_paragraph: In his purge of Egypt’s top generals, President Mohamed Morsi leaned on the support of a junior officer corps that blamed the old guard for a litany of problems within the military.

headline.seo: Purge Shows Impatience Within Egypt’s Military
headline.main: Egypt Lifts a Junior Corps Impatient Over Military Failure
headline.print_headline: Egypt Lifts a Junior Corps Impatient Over Military Failure

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.value: Supreme Council of the Armed Forces
